---

## GAD-7 vs HRQOL

Software As researchers or professionals in the field of psychology and social sciences, we constantly need to analyze and compare the results of varying questionnaires. An instance of such would be the GAD-7 vs HRQOL. GAD-7 (Generalised Anxiety Disorder Assessment) and HRQOL (Health-related quality of life) are widely used to gauge an individual's state of mental health and quality of life. But undertaking a comparative analysis can be tedious and time-consuming, leading to a common problem - harmonisation. How do we resolve this dilemma of GAD-7 vs HRQOL? Enter Harmony - a revolutionary tool using natural language processing and generative AI models. Harmony aims to simplify harmonisation by providing a platform to analyze and compare instruments such as GAD-7 and HRQOL. With a user-friendly interface and an efficient system, Harmony can provide a percentage match between each item on GAD-7 and HRQOL in the blink of an eye. Furthermore, Harmony doesn't limit its users to its database; you can quickly upload your own instruments in PDF form. Harmony's role in comparing GAD-7 vs HRQOL doesn't stop at just simplifying harmonisation. Harmony can provide clear data to test whether results are consistent across studies or differ in response to changing social conditions. This opens doors for a comprehensive evaluation and profound conclusions. Using Harmony for GAD-7 vs HRQOL is a step forward to making full use of cohort and longitudinal studies in the ever-evolving fields of psychology and social sciences. Make the most of Harmony today, and bring simplicity, clarity, and efficiency to your research.

## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
